message.content: To answer this question correctly, we need to apply the formula for calculating speed, which is speed = distance/time. The question states that the person drove two hundred miles today and knows the amount of time spent. To figure out how fast they went, they need to divide the distance traveled (200 miles) by the time spent. Option (A) is incorrect because it refers to being behind a horse, which is unrelated to calculating speed. Option (B) is also incorrect because eating ice cream has no impact on calculating speed. Option (D) is incorrect because driving with windows down does not affect the calculation of speed. Only option (C) is relevant because it pertains to driving on the road, which is the factor that determines the distance traveled.

This question requires basic knowledge about the calculation of speed. In order to calculate speed, one needs to know the distance traveled and the time taken. Option (C) is correct because knowing the distance traveled (200 miles) and the time spent on the road, one can calculate their speed by dividing the distance by the time. Options (A), (B), and (D) are unrelated to calculating speed and are meant to distract the reader.
